factText: More than 1.5 million people have already been ordered to evacuate coastal areas ahead of the storm. Forecast track for Hurricane Florence. factText: According to the National Hurricane Center, there is an increasing risk of two life-threatening impacts from Florence: storm surge at the coast and freshwater flooding from prolonged heavy rain inland. Hurricane Florence could affect people living hundreds of miles inland from the coast with destructive high winds, torrential rain, floods, and power outages. A ridge could cause Florence to stall just after landfall, leading to major inland flooding in the Carolinas, forecasters say.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_Hurricane_How far inland is flooding occurring due to {event}?

factText: Latest projection for Tropical Storm Florence is centered on Wilmington, NC, adding more urgency to State of Emergency declared in both Carolinas. Florence will hit hurricane status Sunday, NOAA says. States of emergency have already been declared in some states on the East Coast as Florence barrels closer as a potentially major hurricane this week.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q025

factText: Florence is expected to intensify and become a hurricane today and potentially a major hurricane (Category 3 or above) tomorrow. Florence is expected to become a major hurricane on Monday and a Category 4 hurricane (140-150 MPH winds) by the middle of the week. ICYMI: Florence officially re-strengthens to a Category 1 Hurricane, could make landfall as early as Thursday or Friday. STORY: https://bit.ly/2Cz2p1m
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_Hurricane_What is the category of the hurricane impacting {event}?

factText: MYRTLE BEACH, SC (WMBF) — Emergency operations around South Carolina continue preparations for Hurricane Florence to make landfall. factText: ***HURRICANE PREPARATION -DON’T FORGET TO INCLUDE YOUR PETS*** Today is the day to begin preparations, should Hurricane Florence continue on its current path. While the impacts are still uncertain, meteorologists are urging residents along the Southeast and mid-Atlantic coasts to begin preparing for the storm.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q024

factText: Florence is expected to bring dangerous conditions to the East Coast later this week. The time is now to make sure your emergency plan is in place!. The Somerville Office of Emergency Management (OEM) along with our public safety partners are monitoring the track of Hurricane Florence.

factText: 11AM Sunday Update - INTENSITY: Florence restrengthened into a category 1 hurricane this morning after NOAA Hurricane Hunters found it has sustained winds of 75 mph. #NEW: Tropical Storm Florence, now approaching the East Coast of the U.S., has now become a Hurricane with sustained winds over 75 mph. Hurricane Florence is strengthening now with sustained winds at 85 mph gusting to 105 mph. 11 a.m advisory shows Florence is now a category one hurricane with max sustained winds of 75 mph.

factText: Both North & South Carolina are bracing for Hurricane Florence. The Carolinas are on high alert with Florence, possibly becoming a major hurricane, bearing down on them. East coast needs to watch strong Tropical Storm Florence which is forecast to be a major Hurricane. 11pm AST advisory from the National Hurricane Center. Hurricane and Storm Surge Watches are in effect through the end of the week for the entire coastline along both North and South Carolina.

factText: As Hurricane Florence makes its way closer to the NC coast, residents are preparing by stocking up on basic necessities like bottled water.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-General-q021

factText: Gov. Henry McMaster urged South Carolina residents on Sunday to prepare for Hurricane Florence, though he said it’s too early to say when or if he will issue evacuation orders. Friends and family along the coast should listen to any evacuation orders this week. "Three quarters of a million to one million North Carolinians have been asked to evacuated.”. Millions of people are being evacuated in an effort to get them out of harm’s way.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-004_general_Are evacuation orders still in place or have they been lifted?

factText: When a mandatory evacuation order is given, 12 Horry County schools could open as shelters and are operational within four hours of the order. This is list of pet friendly evacuation shelters for people displaced from Hurricane Florence. Pet-friendly shelters are designed to accommodate household pets during an evacuation. Across the Southeast, people were urged to put together emergency supply kits, prepare their homes and research evacuation routes.
